patient_info: Muscle weakness,Pericardial effusion,Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology,Palpitations,Vomiting,Abdominal pain,Dyspnea,Exercise intolerance,Poor appetite,Vascular tortuosity,Atrial fibrillation,Tricuspid regurgitation,Pedal edema,Right bundle branch block,Abnormal ST segment,Left ventricular systolic dysfunction,Right atrial enlargement,Increased circulating NT-proBNP concentration,Left atrial enlargement,Abnormality of internal jugular vein
golden_diagnosis: Cardiomyopathy, familial restrictive, 1,家族性/特发性限制型心肌病/Familial/Idiopathic restrictive cardiomyopathy,Cardiomyopathy, familial restrictive, 3,Cardiomyopathy, dilated, 1KK,Cardiomyopathy, familial hypertrophic, 26
predict_diagnosis:
1. Myopathy or muscular dystrophy
2. Cardiomyopathy, restrictive or hypertrophic
3. Atrial septal defect (ASD) or ventricular septal defect (VSD)
4. Congenital heart disease with shunt lesions
5. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or pulmonary hypertension (PAH)
6. Neonatal Marfan syndrome or adult-onset Marfan syndrome
7. Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia (ARVD) or desminopathy/myopathy
8. Thyroid disease (hypo- or hyperthyroidism)
9. Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) or vasculitis
10. Metabolic disorder (e.g., electrolyte imbalance, renal disease)

Please note that these top 10 diagnoses are based on the provided patient phenotype and should be further evaluated with appropriate tests, such as electrocardiography (ECG), echocardiography, blood tests, and genetic testing, to narrow down the final diagnosis. It is important to consider other less likely possibilities and exclude other common conditions that may present with similar symptoms.
